Description: Shoulder and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic red-figured pottery semi-closed vessel, probably a stamnos; interior: shoulder reserved, glazed streaky black below; exterior: tongues at top of shoulder; below, red-figure decoration consisting of apple tree branches with reserved apples with incised stalks and added red leaves of grape-vine type; in centre, upright shaft without leaves; at left edge of sherd, part of undetermined reserved motif.
Curator's comments: The vertical shaft might be for propping up the branches, or for knocking down the apples. For another apple-picking scene, see New York 07.286.74 by the Orchard Painter, ARV 523, no. 1.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E436.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0280) (Phase 1)
